commitResults.messageTitle: Rename chatbot, add PrintLine utility, greet and exit and adjust testcase
Echo user input and adjust testcase
Add list and utility functions for list processing
Adjust members of Ben class to private access modifier
Edit names of class members to follow convention
commitResults.messageBody:
Name conventions do not adhere to Java conventions for CS2103T.

Change names of class members to follow the Java naming
conventions:
* Changed method names to use camel case
* Changed constant names to all uppercase
* Changed array name to plural

The constant `LINE` has been transferred:
* Removed `LINE` and put it among the member declarations.

The constant `LINE` has been removed from the method and
declared as a private static final member of the class to
ensure that it is accessible in the class in case other
methods require it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change function comment to use javadoc
Add index number to printElements method
Refactor code in Ben.java to add and list
Adjust input and test case
Change import directive from java.util.* to java.util.Scanner
Create Task class
Create package ben.task and adjusted directories for package
Rewrite Ben class to use ben.task.Task and add Task commands
commitResults.messageBody:
The Ben class uses an array of strings and
is not extensible to use the commands for the Task class,
which has commands with parameters and is required for Level-3.

Therefore, the following measures are done:
* Change `strings` and `stringsLength` to `tasks` and `tasksSize`
   respectively and for `tasks` to be of type `Task[]`.
* Rename `addElement` to `addTask` and `printElements` to `printTasks`.
* Rewrite javadoc method comments
   for `addTask` and `printTasks` to clarify
   the usage of the array `tasks` and the variable
   storing its size `tasksSize` and rewrote method bodies
   to use the `Task` class and its methods.
* Rewrite command identifying logic to instead first
   split user input into command and parameters
   and then use the first word to identify the command.
* Add `markAndPrintTaskDone` to mark a task as done
   and print a confirmation message.
* Add `markAndPrintTask` to mark a task as undone
   and print a confirmation message.
* Add `mark` and `unmark` as recognized commands.

These renaming measures are implemented to ensure that names of
members of the Ben class are consistent with their intended
usage and self-explanatory.

The rewriting of the logic to identify
commands is done to make the codebase more extensible for user
input which could include parameters that is introduced
in Level-3.

The rest of the changes are intended to add the task
marking functionality as required for Level-3.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Element to Task in names and comments for clarity
Add greet dialogue comment
Update test case
Rewrite Task class to partial solution
commitResults.messageBody:
The Task class does not support access to attributes
by potential subclasses and methods that are shown in
the partial solution.

Let's:
* Change the access modifier of attributes to `protected`.
* Implement the methods `getStatusIcon`, `markAsDone`,
   and `markAsUndone`.
* Remove the `setIsDone` method.

The `protected` access modifier is used to allow future
subclasses to access the attributes of the Task class
directly and setIsDone is removed due to redundancy
(the same actions can be performed using the `markAsDone`
and `markAsUndone` methods).

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove whitespace to fix formatting
Add parameter detail to Task constructor
Create Todo class
Create Deadline class
Create Event class
Add todo command to Ben class
commitResults.messageBody:
The todo command is not yet implemented in the Ben class.

Let's:
* Add `commandParametersLength` to store the number of
   words in the user's input.
* Implement the todo command to add a todo task to the
   task list.
* Implement utility method `printTaskAdditionMessage`
   to confirm the addition of the new task at the end.

`commandParametersLength` is used in rebuilding the todo task
description from the user's input after it being split.
`printTaskAdditionMessage` is implemented as a utility method
because all tasks have the same addition confirmation
message format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add deadline command to Ben class
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline command to be added to Ben class to allow
tasks with deadlines.

Implementation details:
* Use `byIndex` to specify index of the "/by" word in
   `commandParameters`.
* Use `StringBuilder` to construct the strings from
    `commandParameters`.
* Terminate the for loop once "/by" is encountered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add event command to Ben class
commitResults.messageBody:
Event command to be added to Ben class to allow
tasks with certain start and end dates/times.

Implementation details:
* Use `fromIndex` and `toIndex` to specify index of the
   "/from" and "/to" words in`commandParameters`.
* Use `StringBuilder` to construct the strings from
   `commandParameters`.
* Terminate the for loops once "/to" and "/from"
   are encountered.

Create BenException class as superclass
Create BenException subclasses
Add try-catch block for exception handling
Use exceptions in setMarkDone and setMarkUndone
Update methods to throw marking exceptions
Handle todo exception from user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Exceptions where the description is not included in
todo commands are not handled.

Let's:
* Check if the description is missing for todo
  commands by checking `commandParametersLength`
  and throw BenEmptyParameterValueException if it is.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle deadline exceptions from user input
commitResults.messageBody:
The following invalid input cases from the user input
are not handled:
* There is no description for the deadline command
* There is no "/by" for the deadline command
* There is no date/time after "/by" for
  the deadline command

Let's:
* Check if the description is empty by checking if
  `commandParametersLength` and throw
  BenEmptyParameterValueException if so.
* Check if "/by" is present in the user input by
  checking whether `byIndex` is null and throw
  BenMissingByParameterException if so.
* Check if there is date/time after "/by" by checking
  `commandParametersLength` by comparing it with
  `byIndex + 1` to check whether `/by` is the Last
  parameter and throw BenEmptyParameterValueException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle event exceptions from user input
commitResults.messageBody:
The cases where the user input for the command event
is invalid because of the following:
* It does not contain the description of the event.
* It does not contain "/from".
* It does not contain the date/time of the event after
  "/from".
* It does not contain "/to".
* It does not contain the date/time of the event after
  "/to".

Let's:
* Check whether the description is missing and throw
  a BenEmptyParameterValueException if so.
* Check whether "/from" is missing and throw a
  BenMissingParameterException if so.
* Check whether the date/time after "/from" is missing
  and throw a BenEmptyParameterValueException if so.
* Check whether "/to" is missing and throw a
  BenMissingParameterException if so.
* Check whether the date/time after "/to" is missing
  and throw a BenEmptyParameterValueException if so.

Update test case
Refactor Ben class to use ArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
The Ben class does not utilize ArrayList for
`tasks` rather than an array `String[]`. This would
satisfy the requirement `A-Collections` and remove
the maximum limit of 100 tasks at a time.

Let's:
* Change the type of `tasks` from `String[]` to
  `ArrayList<String>`.
* Update all member methods using `tasks` to use the
  appropriate APIs of `ArrayList` (e.g. add, remove,
  size).
* Remove the static attribute `tasksLength` since
  `tasks` is no longer an array and its length not
  limited to a maximum of 100.
* Remove the method `addTask` since it is no longer
  necessary to increment `tasksLength` and
  can just be replaced with an invocation of the
  method `tasks.add`.
